subject: Empanelment of Advocates & Allotment of Land Acquisition; Arbitration & Court Cases and Payment of Fee to Advocates -reg.
text: TRally vefy TTTHf qferarrut (7sd5 qRae7t &r TTArf TR4, TRG TraFR) National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways, Government of India) Hrqa j4a j1-5 Qi 6, 8azr-10, arau; * @aait 110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 TMN/Phone 91-11-25074100 / 25074200 NHAI/ Policy Guidelines/ Land Acquisition/ 2025 Policy Circular No.7.1.85/2025 dated 20th June, 2025 {Decision taken on E-Office File No. LADIV- 11011/2/2025-COORD Division (Comp. No. 275076)} Sub: Empanelment of Advocates & Allotment of Land Acquisition, Arbitration & Court Cases and Payment of Fee to Advocates -reg: Ref. = 1) Policy Circular No. 2.6.2 dated 01.03.2004 ii)  Policy Circular No. 7.1.34 dated 04.09.2014 iii) Policy Circular No. 2.5.8 dated 10.09.2015 The Land Arbitration & Court Cases are allocated to Advocates/Law Firms by concerned Regional Offices for which the eligibility, their empanelment are being checked and made by the concerned Regional Offices as per the Circulars given at ref. (i) to (iii). 2 Recently, details of the empanelment order of each Advocate, Advocates who are empanelled but not allocated any cases, copies of the roster while allocating cases, criteria adopted for allocating cases to Advocates, Advocate who is empanelled without fulfilling the eligibility criteria, any Junior Advocate is appearing on behalf of empanelled Advocate who is not fulfilling the eligibility criteria were examined_ 3 It is necessary that in the Regional Offices Roster System need to be followed while allocating the cases to Advocates and it is to be ensured that Junior Advocates do not appear on behalf of empanelled Advocate. Allocation of cases among the Advocates need to be rationalized: 4. Considering this, a revised Policy has been framed for Empanelment; Allotment, Maintaining Roster in Land Acquisition Arbitration & Court Cases. A: Empanelment of Advocatesl Law Firms in Land Acquisition Arbitration & Court Cases: 1s For dealing the cases at the District/Arbitration Court: RO/PIU should maintain sufficient Number of Advocates/Law Firms empanelled to meet the case load as per laid criteria. For this, Panel should be formed by the concerned PIU by forwarding the CVs of the Advocates/Law Firms to concerned Regional Office and after scrutiny and approval of Regional Office. ji. For dealing the cases at the High Court: Regional Office should maintain a Panel of minimum 5 Advocate/ Law Firm which should be updated on yearly basis. For this, Panel should be formed after scrutiny by the concerned Regional Office. iii. For dealing the cases at the Supreme Court Cases: LA division, HQ should maintain a Panel of minimum 5 Advocate/Law Firm in consultation with Legal Division which should be updated on yearly basis. For this, Panel should be formed after scrutiny by the concerned LA Division , HQ: iv. Eligibility of Individual AdvocatelAdvocate in Law Firms for Empanelment: a. For Arbitration & District Courts Advocates having experience of 3 or more years in Land Acquisition Empanelment at PIU Level with approval of RO_ Contd_2/ - #772 NHAL Policy
